The narrator of this video made an error in that the type of fermentation happening in those barrels is lacto fermentation. The salt put in the peppers allows for the Lactobacillus to thrive while inhibiting yeasts and other micro organisms from growing. The barrels allow for CO2 to escape, and the salt on top act to prevent any micro organisms surviving and leaking in as the barrel "burps"
After they are satisfied with the fermentation, vinegar is added to prevent it from fermenting further, as well as break down the pepper material, more so the former reason than the latter.
If it were a yeast fermentation, you would wind up with alcohol, not a tangy hot sauce.
